gurmukhi: ਬੂੰਦ ਬੂੰਦ ਬਰਖ ਪਨਾਰੇ ਬਹਿ ਚਲੈ ਜਲੁ ਬਹੁਰਿਓ ੳੁਮਗਿ ਬਹੈ ਬੀਥੀ ਬੀਥੀ ਅਾੲਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Boond Boond Barakh Panaaray Bahi Chalai Jalu , Bahuriao Oumagi Bahai Beedee Beedee Aai Kai ?
translation: Every drop of rain joins the other and together they flow from the roof-tops into the streets and then in the storm water drains; And overflowing its banks, the water flows through many rivulets and join the main stream or rivers;

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਤੇ ਨੋਰਾ ਨੋਰਾ ਭਰਿ ਚਲਤ ਚਤਰ ਕੁੰਟ ਸਰਿਤਾ ਸਰਿਤਾ ਪ੍ਰਤਿ ਮਿਲਤ ਹੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Taa Tay Noraa Noraa Bhari Chalat Chatar Kounta , Saritaa Saritaa Prati Milat Hai Jaai Kai ?
translation: And all the water of the rivers flow to achieve union with sea and once it falls in it, become one with it. It loses its individuality. The truth is, whatever are the traits of a person, he is praised and recognised accordingly (Some may behave mean, frol

gurmukhi: ਸਰਿਤਾ ਸਕਲ ਜਲ ਪ੍ਰਬਲ ਪ੍ਵਾਹ ਚਲਿ ਸੰਗਮ ਸਮੁੰਦ੍ਰ ਹੋਤ ਸਮਤ ਸਮਾੲਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Saritaa Sakal Jal Prabal Pravaah Chali , Sangam Samoundr Hot Samat Samaai Kai ?
translation: Just as a diamond held in hand seems very small but when evaluated and sold, fills the coffers. Just as a cheque/draft carried on person has no weight but when cashed at the other end yields much money

gurmukhi: ਜਾ ਮੈ ਜੈਸੀਅੈ ਸਮਾੲੀ ਤੈਸੀਅੈ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਬਡਾੲੀ ਓਛੌ ਅੳੁ ਗੰਭੀਰ ਧੀਰ ਬੂਝੀਅੈ ਬੁਲਾੲਿ ਕੈ ॥੩੭੨॥
transliteration: Jaa Mai Jaiseeai Samaaee Taiseeai Mahimaa Badaaee , Aochhau Au Ganbheer Dheer Boojheeai Bulaai Kai ?372?
translation: Just as seed of a banyan tree is very small but when sown grows into big tree and spreads all over. Similar is the significance of the lodging of true Guru's teachings in the hearts of obedient Sikhs of the Guru. This is reckoned only on reaching the divi
